author: Lucero Valenzuela
title: Magaly Medina vuelve a enfurecer con su DJ y anuncia nuevo casting: "¬°Cu√°ndo entender√°n!"
text: Magaly Medina vuelve a enfurecer con su DJ y anuncia nuevo casting: "¬°Cu√°ndo entender√°n!" ¬°Otro despedido! Magaly Medina pas√≥ un bochornoso momento al ser v√≠ctima de un nuevo error de su DJ. Mira aqu√≠ c√≥mo reaccion√≥. [√önete al canal de Whatsapp de El Popular](https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029Va1lDJP0AgWIrsim8w1F) [Pamela L√≥pez responde EN VIVO en Amor y Fuego tras declaraciones de Pamela Franco y Christian Cueva](https://elpopular.pe/espectaculos/nacionales/2024/08/29/pamela-lopez-rompe-su-silencio-en-vivo-en-amor-y-fuego-tras-supuesta-relacion-entre-pamela-franco-y-christian-cueva-amenazas-denuncias-y-mas-2021213) [Jorge Luna y Ricardo Mendoza no ayudar√°n econ√≥micamente a fan√°tico que muri√≥: Esta es la raz√≥n](https://elpopular.pe/espectaculos/nacionales/2024/08/29/jorge-luna-y-ricardo-mendoza-no-ayudaran-economicamente-a-familia-de-irwin-meza-fanatico-que-murio-esta-es-la-razon-hablando-huevadas-2721244) [Magaly Medina](https://elpopular.pe/tag/magaly-medina) volvi√≥ a desatar su furia contra su DJ luego de protagonizar un bochornoso momento debido a que este cometi√≥ un error durante el inicio de su programa en vivo. La conductora anunci√≥ que har√° un nuevo casting para lograr encontrar a un musicalizador que realmente entienda los gustos musicales que ella prefiere en su set de televisi√≥n. PUEDES VER: [Magaly Medina denuncia amenazas a su reportera tras reportaje a Luis Fernando Rodr√≠guez, la 'pareja' de Pamela L√≥pez] ¬øPor qu√© Magaly Medina enfureci√≥ con su DJ? El incidente ocurri√≥ cuando empezaba su programa 'Magaly TV, la firme'. Fiel a su estilo, la presentadora de ATV quiso bailar el tema que hab√≠a elegido, pero un error del DJ le quit√≥ los √°nimos: la canci√≥n estaba bien, pero no era el fragmento que ella le hab√≠a indicado previamente. Su rostro expres√≥ molestia, pero pudo contenerse en plena transmisi√≥n de se√±al abierta. Aunque no dijo textualmente que el musicalizador hab√≠a sido despedido, le mand√≥ un fuerte mensaje que confirm√≥, de manera sutil, que quer√≠a su salida del puesto de trabajo. "¬°Cu√°ndo entender√°n! El estribillo le digo y entr√≥ desde el principio de la canci√≥n, √©l cree que estamos en una reuni√≥n familiar...", expres√≥. Luego revel√≥ que junto a su equipo de producci√≥n llevar√°n a cabo un segundo casting a nivel nacional en las instalaciones del canal. Indic√≥ que la convocatoria iniciar√° el pr√≥ximo lunes 2 de septiembre. "Reanudo la b√∫squeda del DJ, alguno habr√° que entienda qu√© es lo que necesitamos aqu√≠", agreg√≥. PUEDES VER: [Magaly Medina asegura que se sinti√≥ amenazada por Tom√°s Angulo con su carta notarial: "Me parece matonesco"] ¬øC√≥mo fue el anterior error del DJ de Magaly Medina? El inicio del programa Magaly TV La Firme del 26 de agosto estuvo marcado por un momento tenso debido a un error inesperado del DJ al no colocar la m√∫sica solicitada por Magaly Medina. La conductora expres√≥ su descontento, se√±alando que este tipo de situaciones no deber√≠an ocurrir y que eran la raz√≥n por la cual no manten√≠a una buena relaci√≥n con los DJs que participaban en su programa. "Oye la m√∫sica, ¬øQu√© pas√≥? Despu√©s dicen que por qu√© mis DJ's y yo no nos llevamos bien. ¬øPuedes soltarme m√∫sica por fa? Gracias, dos soles de m√∫sica, a ver si me das dos soles (...) Gracias, despedido del DJ, gracias por tus servicios. Dios m√≠o, no pueden poner una buena m√∫sica. ¬øNo digo yo?", dijo la presentadora expresando su molestia. Periodista especializada en espect√°culos, cine y TV. Bachiller en Ciencias de la Comunicaci√≥n de la Universidad Nacional Federico Villarreal. Redactora de espect√°culos en El Popular. Interesada en temas sobre far√°ndula peruana, celebridades internacionales, m√∫sica y pel√≠culas.

author: @CiberCuba
title: La Diosa asegura que La Cintumbare est√° "huyendo" tras demanda en su contra
text: La pol√©mica entre Dianelys Alfonso Cartaya, La Diosa, y Cintia Medrero Garc√≠a, conocida como La Cintumbare, ha llegado a un punto sin retorno pues la cantante inci√≥ acciones legales contra la influencer. En sus cuentas en Facebook e Instagram la int√©rprete de ‚ÄúMe dio la gana‚Äù comparti√≥ un video en el que pidi√≥ ayuda a sus seguidores para encontrar el paradero de La Cintumbare para que la polic√≠a pueda entregarle personalmente la √∫ltima notificaci√≥n sobre la demanda que debe firmar. Seg√∫n La Diosa, La Cintumbare ‚Äúrecibi√≥ una primera carta de parte de las abogadas y a partir de ese momento comenz√≥ a mudarse. Para las personas que no sepan c√≥mo funciona esto, la √∫ltima carta, que es la √∫ltima carta importante, se entrega en la mano de la persona y esa persona debe firmarla y es entregada a trav√©s de un polic√≠a‚Äù. ‚ÄúMe quiero dirigir a todos mis seguidores, ya que ella se est√° escondiendo y huyendo como una rata y no es lo que ella dice en redes sociales, que me ayuden a conseguir la direcci√≥n de ella (‚Ä¶) Conf√≠o en que todos mis seguidores que no apoyan este tipo de situaciones, me apoyen y me ayuden a obtener el verdadero paradero de ellos. S√© que ella no va a tener todo el tiempo del mundo para estar mud√°ndose toda la vida. Sin embargo, yo s√≠ tengo todo el tiempo del mundo para encontrarla‚Äù, asegur√≥ la cantante. Sobre los motivos detr√°s de esta demanda a La Cintumbare, La Diosa a√±adi√≥: ‚ÄúEsta mujer, como ustedes vieron, ha difamado a mi hijo, ha difamado a mi esposo, me ha difamado a m√≠ en varias ocasiones (‚Ä¶) Mi hijo ha sido bastante afectado con las palabras de ella y le ha tra√≠do much√≠simas situaciones en todos los sentidos, en la escuela, con amigos, con todo, y psicol√≥gicamente‚Äù. ‚ÄúNo me van a ver reaccionando a ning√∫n tipo de respuesta de ella en redes sociales, conf√≠o en todos mis seguidores en la ayuda que me puedan dar y nos vemos en la Corte‚Äù, concluy√≥ La Diosa su video. ¬øQu√© opinas? [COMENTAR](https://disqus.amp-cache.org/disqus/index.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cibercuba.com%2Fnoticias%2F2024-04-25-u208487-e208487-s27065-nid280984-diosa-asegura-cintumbare-esta-huyendo-tras&nid=280984&title=La%20Diosa%20asegura%20que%20La%20Cintumbare%20est%C3%A1%20%22huyendo%22%20tras%20demanda%20en%20su%20contra) Archivado en: ¬øTienes algo que reportar? Escribe a CiberCuba:

author: Lydia Mee
title: Italian GP: Kevin Magnussen Suffers Crash In FP2 After Hefty FP1 Fine
text: Kevin Magnussen 's weekend at the Italian Grand Prix went from bad to worse after a crash during Free Practice 2 (FP2), following a hefty fine for Haas after an infraction in Free Practice 1 (FP1). During FP2, the Danish driver lost control at the Second Lesmo, Turn 7, striking the barriers after experiencing significant oversteer. This incident brought out the red flag, causing a temporary halt to the session. Sky Sports F1 analyst Karun Chandhok offered his insights into the crash, explaining during the live broadcast: "He turns in, loses the rear end on entry. The car was quite loose as soon as he turns the wheel. "It looks like he had more speed than the grip would allow. As soon as he got on the dust, he was off. "Lesmo 2, you always get an oversteery feeling and have to pre-empt it a bit. Maybe just a bit too much speed on the way in." As a red flag has been waved on the session, Lewis Hamilton is currently at the top of the time sheets followed by Lando Norris and Carlos Sainz. The Danish driver's troubles began earlier in FP1, where Haas was fined √¢‚Äö¬¨7,500 by the FIA stewards after he impeded Carlos Sainz at Turns 6 and 7. The incident caused Sainz to abort his fast lap, and the stewards' report highlighted a crucial communication failure by the Haas team. The team√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s miscommunication failed to warn Magnussen of Sainz's rapid approach, as indicated by telemetry data that should have prompted earlier alerts. The stewards' investigation included thorough reviews of positioning data, video footage, timing, telemetry, and team radio exchanges. The official report from the stewards detaile: "Session:√Ç Practice 1 "Fact:√Ç Car 20 impeded Car 55 in turn 7. "Infringement:√Ç Breach of Article 37.5 of the FIA Formula One Sporting Regulations. "Decision:√Ç The competitor (MoneyGram Haas F1 Team) is fined √¢‚Äö¬¨7,500. "Reason:√Ç The Stewards heard from the driver of Car 20 (Kevin Magnussen), the driver of Car 55 (Carlos Sainz), team representatives and reviewed positioning/marshalling system data, video, timing, telemetry, team radio and in-car video evidence. "The team radio of Car 20 revealed that no warning of the approach of Car 55 was given until the very moment that Car 55 was immediately behind it. The driver of Car 20 explained that he checked his mirrors and because of the track layout at that point, Car 55 was not visible. Further, between Turns 6 and 7 there was one other car driving slowly between Cars 20 and 55, off the racing line. "The driver of Car 55 stated in evidence that the situation was not dangerous. "It was obvious from the GPS data, available to the Team, that Car 55 was rapidly approaching and overtaking cars behind Car 20 and therefore adequate prior warning should have been given to the driver of Car 20. "Normally, in accordance with our Penalty Guidelines, a formal warning would be issued to the driver of Car 20 however in this case we consider that because the track layout at this point did not facilitate visibility of Car 55's approach, such a warning is undeserved. "Impeding incidents in Free Practice are normally not investigated unless they are potentially dangerous or involve an error by the Team. In this case, although the Team made an error, the situation was not potentially dangerous and hence the penalty on the Team is reduced to half that of the previous two precedents this year."

author: francaisenouvelles
title: La c√¥te californienne battue par des vagues massives
text:
Massive waves flood California beach towns as evacuations ordered
Forecasters say waves as high as 40 feet are possible Thursday in some locations along the California coast, with another round of swells set to arrive Saturday.
SAN FRANCISCO ‚Äì Up and down the
California coast, monster waves battered beach towns Thursday churned up by a powerful storm in the Pacific Ocean.
From
San Diego to Los Angeles and beyond San Francisco, the National Weather Service issued Coastal Flood Warnings and High Surf Warnings for breaking waves between 28 and 33 feet. Some locations were forecast to see waves as high as 40 feet.
The massive waves overtook
beaches and coastal roads. Some even crashed against homes and businesses.
The debris deposited on streets was so heavy that road crews used plows to clear the scenic State Highway 1, south of San Francisco. Other stretches of the road were too buried to clear.
CALIFORNIA BEACH HOME TO SOME OF LARGEST WAVES IN THE WORLD
Officials issued evacuation orders for several northern and central California coastal communities.
"We put evacuation warnings into place around 8 a.m. this morning for this area, and, as you can see, these waves are incredibly powerful," Ashley Keehn, the
Santa Cruz County Sheriff's Office Information Officer, told KTVU FOX 2. "They're washing logs up here. A lot of debris, a lot of driftwood. So we've been asking people to avoid the direct coastal area." HOW WEATHER IMPACTS WAVES DURING SURFING COMPETITIONS
Not everyone heeded the advice, however, and ended up soaked.
ACTIVE EL NINO PATTERN DELIVERS WITH SURF AS HIGH AS 50 FEET IN PACIFIC STRONG EL NINO WINTER: WHAT KIND OF WEATHER YOU CAN EXPECT
The waves kept coming. Take a look at this aerial picture of
Ventura, California. The swells come in sets, one after another.
Ventura County
rescue crews were kept busy with both rescues and injury calls as waves smashed windows and glass doors of homes and swept onlookers off piers and beaches.
A wave in Ventura County, north of Los Angeles, topped the pier. The NWS estimated that it was 20 feet high.
WATCH: MASSIVE ROGUE WAVE BATTERS CRUISE SHIP IN NORTH SEA
Coastal Flood
Warnings and High Surf Warnings in Northern California expire late Thursday and early Friday morning. The NWS warned that the next set of big swells will arrive Saturday. The Los Angeles NWS office is not taking any chances, and Southern California warnings are in place through Saturday night. The worst of the flooding occurs at high tide.

author: The Nation Newspaper
title: Oyo rolls out measures against cholera outbreak in public schools
text:
The Oyo State Government has implemented measures to prevent cholera outbreak in public basic schools, advising headteachers to ensure that food handlers follow strict hygiene practices to prevent contamination.
Chairman, Oyo State Universal Basic Education Board, Dr. Nureni Adeniran handed down the instruction on Saturday in Ibadan.
He said the State Government, through the Board, is on top of its game to ensure public basic schools are taking steps to ensure the health and safety of students.
Adeniran urged parents, guardians, and school authorities to adhere to safety guidelines.
Related News He said the board will work with Education Secretaries, Headteachers, and other stakeholders to ensure strict compliance.
The advisory emphasised the importance of hand hygiene, recommending that children carry hand sanitizers and frequently wash their hands with soap and water, especially before meals and after using the restroom.
He also recommended that schools keep Oral Rehydration Salts (ORS) available in school clinics to manage dehydration cases promptly and to notify the State emergency hotline, 615, immediately in case of any health emergencies or suspected cholera cases.
Adeniran said preventive measures including comprehensive health talks on cholera prevention among learners and staff, and safe drinking water practices, will be conducted regularly.

organizations.name: oyo state universal basic education board

author: Sheree Bega
title: African-made electric motorcycle completes solar-powered journey from Nairobi to Stellenbosch
text:
The Green Guardian / 17 October 2024 African-made electric motorcycle completes solar-powered journey from Nairobi to Stellenbosch By Sheree Bega Facebook X Email LinkedIn WhatsApp The expedition highlighted the potential that mobility, powered by renewable energy, had to transform livelihoods across Africa. An electric motorcycle, designed and built in Africa and powered by the sun, completed its groundbreaking journey from Kenya to South Africa on Wednesday.
Researchers from the faculty of engineering at Stellenbosch University joined forces with Roam , a technology-driven electric mobility company in Nairobi to test the Roam Air it had developed.
The expedition spanned about 6 000km, traversing through Kenya, Tanzania, Malawi, Zambia, Botswana and South Africa. On the second last day, the team covered 1 000km in a single day to reach Stellenbosch.
The journey got under way on 17 September, when the support team and a vehicle-based solar power station departed from Stellenbosch. Upon reaching Nairobi on 27 September, they collected the electric motorcycle. The team, led by PhD candidate Stephan Lacock , embarked on their return leg on 29 September
Throughout the trip the motorcycle‚Äôs swappable batteries were charged exclusively through solar power, highlighting the viability of renewable energy in real-world applications.
‚ÄúThe journey has actually made us aware of a few things,‚Äù said Thinus Booysen , professor of engineering and founder of the Electric Mobility Lab at Stellenbosch University, who joined the expedition team for a week in Zambia and Botswana. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs interesting how doing this has shaped our way of thinking about the problem.
‚ÄúIt was very apparent as we moved through Africa how the need is so desperate for mobility. I don‚Äôt think I appreciated this sufficiently. It‚Äôs amazing how every place we stopped, people would stop, walk up and say, ‚ÄòWhat is this bike, what does it do, can I get one?‚Äù
Mobility is a fundamental freedom. ‚ÄúThe ability to move around is so important to have a livelihood; it gets you to services, it gets you to hospitals, it gets you to schools. It gets you running a business,‚Äù Booysen said.
What was also evident was the desperate need for jobs, particularly in countries like Malawi and Zambia.
‚ÄúI think that penny dropped for me is that with a job comes dignity and I think to a large extent what we‚Äôre fighting for here is for jobs. If we make these vehicles locally, you‚Äôre building technical jobs, people will have jobs assembling them and maintaining them. If we import these vehicles from other areas, those jobs are gone,‚Äù Booysen said.
The expedition also highlighted the potential that mobility, powered by renewable energy, has to transform livelihoods across Africa, he said.
A bike can run a business. ‚ÄúYou can carry people, move them around, you can carry goods, you can take things to market. It‚Äôs just incredible how quickly people latched onto this notion that this bike will open up opportunities for me.
‚ÄúIt really blew my mind how many people rode around on normal bicycles and then they‚Äôve got up to 70kg worth of charcoal in the back of the bike. With electric [bikes], everything will move quicker, it will just change their lives,‚Äù Booysen said.
Completing the journey marks a historic milestone for Roam Air as the first African-made electric motorcycle to achieve such a feat, said Masa Kituyi , the product owner at the company. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a testament to our commitment to pushing the boundaries of electric mobility.‚Äù
From the difficult terrains to the warm welcomes from locals, ‚Äúwe saw the spark of excitement in people‚Äôs eyes when they realised this motorcycle was built in Africa‚Äù, Kituyi said.
Roam Air‚Äôs collaboration with Stellenbosch University ‚Äúhighlighted the resilience of both our teams and technology, proving that clean energy can power not just vehicles, but a brighter, more sustainable future for the continent‚Äù, he added.
Despite the successful completion of the journey, the team faced numerous problems along the way. Booysen said rainy weather in Malawi created difficult travel conditions while poor roads tested the vehicle‚Äôs durability. Lengthy stops at border crossings added costly delays during precious daylight hours.
‚ÄúSome issues with solar connectors that were not made for daily disconnecting and reconnecting further complicated the journey,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúHowever, the team‚Äôs resilience and commitment to their mission allowed them to overcome these obstacles, showcasing the strength in collaborative applied research and the viability of solar-powered electric mobility solutions on the continent.‚Äù
The technical skills of the engineers came together. ‚ÄúWe had a multidisciplinary team of electrical, mechanical, civil and industrial engineers and it was amazing to see how those skills really helped us through all the problem-solving we had to do.‚Äù
Electric mobility is not necessarily about lowering Africa‚Äôs carbon emissions because the continent is a small contributor to global emissions.
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs about clean cities, clean air and it was clear driving through Zambia that the pollution is so bad that you can see what you are breathing. If we just take all of these polluting cars and vehicles off the road, then that‚Äôs going to improve substantially already,‚Äù Booysen said.
The team saw Africa at its finest, he added. Along the route, they encountered a variety of wildlife, including elephants, rhinos, giraffes, hippos, buffalo, lions, sables, baboons, monkeys and crocodiles.
For Booysen, the journey through the continent‚Äôs diverse landscapes reinforced the importance of preserving these environments for future generations and demonstrated how clean energy can play a role in their protection.
‚ÄúAll of that is at risk if we don‚Äôt look after the environment, right? That‚Äôs the other thing we‚Äôve got to focus on with electric mobility ‚Äî we‚Äôve got to try to protect the environment.‚Äù
Sibusiso Moyo , deputy vice-chancellor for research, innovation and postgraduate study at Stellenbosch University, described their expedition as ‚Äúnot only testimony to the sheer determination of the research team‚Äù, but it also showcases African ingenuity.
‚ÄúMy heartfelt gratitude to Roam, our research partner, for donating two Roam electric motorcycles to the Electric Mobility Lab,‚Äù Moyo said.
Booysen added he was moved by the leadership shown by the youngsters in the team. ‚ÄúI was blown away by how motivated these guys were to do this. We‚Äôre talking 20-somethings and it was amazing to see the collaboration between Kenya and South Africa.
Tags: African Innovation , African Tech , Clean Transportation , Climate Action , Eco Friendly , Electric Mobility , Electric Motorcycle , Electric Vehicles , Green Technology , Job Creation , local production , Mobility Solutions , Nairobi to Stellenbosch , Renewable Energy , Roam Air , Solar Energy , Stellenbosch University , Sustainable Development , Sustainable Mobility , the-green-guardian , Thinus Booysen

author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Il tabaccaio di piazza Duomo: "Sono campanelli d'allarme, episodi da bloccare subito"
text:
L‚Äôintervento della polizia locale di Ravenna dopo il furto con raggiro messo a segno da due stranieri nella tabaccheria
Prima il furto con destrezza nella tabaccheria di piazza Duomo solo pochi giorni fa, poi l‚Äôaccoltellamento in pieno centro tra il Mercato Coperto e il Costa Caf√©, infine un altro accoltellamento, fortunatamente lieve, di nuovo in piazza Duomo l‚Äôaltra notte che ha coinvolto alcuni minorenni. Qualcosa, nella zona, sta cambiando, lo dicono alcuni residenti che hanno notato gruppi di giovanissimi stazionare nella piazza di sera. Chiedono spiccioli ai passanti o la tessera sanitaria a chi √® maggiorenne per poter acquistare le sigarette al distributore automatico. Fabio Sbaragli da sette anni √® il titolare della tabaccheria nella quale √® avvenuto il furto.
Sbaragli, ha l‚Äôimpressione che la piazza in questi ultimi mesi sia cambiata?
"Qualcosa √® cambiato, anche se quello che √® capitato a me, intendo il furto con destrezza, √® qualcosa da valutare a parte, nel senso che capita ovunque. Un collega di Pesaro nei giorni successivi, dopo aver letto la notizia sui giornali, mi ha chiamato per raccontarmi che gli era capitata la stessa identica cosa".
Invece i ragazzini che si ritrovano nella piazza la sera? L‚Äôaccoltellamento dell‚Äôaltra sera ha coinvolto due minorenni.
"In piazza Duomo non ci sono telecamere, pu√≤ essere che alcuni di quelli che solitamente si ritrovano in piazza Kennedy, dove i controlli sono molto pi√π frequenti e ci sono le telecamere, abbiano deciso di spostarsi qui. Certo che se ci fossero anche in piazza Duomo sarebbe meglio".
E maggiori controlli.
"S√¨, ma anche l√¨, √® questione di fortuna. Dopo aver subito il furto, visionando i filmati delle telecamere ci siamo resi conto che cinque minuti prima era passata davanti al Tabacchi una volante della Polizia locale...Per√≤ √® chiaro che pi√π controlli ci sono, pi√π sicurezza c‚Äô√®".
La mattina quando apre la sua attivit√† le capita di trovare tracce dei ‚Äòbagordi‚Äô notturni?
"Nel fine settimana. Io sono aperto anche la domenica mattina dalle 9 alle 13. Trovo bottiglie per terra, resti di oggetti che mi fanno capire quello che √® successo nella notte, a volte ci sono bottiglie davanti al duomo, sotto al portico. L‚Äôanno scorso hanno tentato di spaccare il vetro del distributore di bibite perch√© una bottiglietta d‚Äôacqua si era incastrata e non usciva. Noi chiudiamo alle 20, il bar a fianco a noi alle 19, siamo gli ultimi. Di quello che √® accaduto la notte ci accorgiamo la mattina dopo".
Si sente meno sicuro quando viene a lavorare dopo gli ultimi episodi?
"No. Credo che questa sia ancora una citt√† di provincia dove si vive bene. √à chiaro che alcuni episodi cos√¨ gravi sono come dei campanelli d‚Äôallarme, sono avvisaglie di una situazione che potrebbe peggiorare, per questo meglio intervenire subito per evitare future degenerazioni".
Annamaria Corrado
¬© Riproduzione riservata

author: Erin Vogt
title: Big NJ companies just announced hundreds of more layoffs
text:
Big NJ companies just announced hundreds of more layoffs
üî∑ NJ companies announce more layoffs
üî∑ Last quarter sees several cuts into new year
üî∑ A couple NJ corporations made 4 rounds of cuts
Two major companies in New Jersey have announced four different rounds of layoffs this year, alone.
Bristol Myers Squibb, out of Lawrenceville, and Prudential Financial, out of Newark, both rounded out previous cuts with separate announcements in September and November.
In both cases, a majority of cuts would take effect in the new year, according to WARN notifications filed with state labor officials.
A third massive NJ-based corporation, Johnson and Johnson, also announced 231 layoffs in September, effective in late December.
Overall, at least 10 companies announced notable NJ layoffs in the last quarter of this year, as seen below.
Biggest NJ company layoffs announced in 2024

author: Calin Van Paris
title: One of Our Favorite Yoga Mats Is on Sale (In Some Seriously Fun Colors)
text:
Your yoga mat is such an essential part of your practice‚Äîit‚Äôs literally your support system and bonded bestie, all rolled into one. That means finding‚Äîand investing in‚Äîthe mat that‚Äôs correct for you is a serious consideration. One YJ editor- and teacher-approved contender is Manduka‚Äôs PROlite Yoga Mat and it‚Äôs currently on sale in an array of bright colors.
My first Manduka Prolite mat was stolen from my car and I hope it‚Äôs still living its best life somewhere out there. Our time together was brief but full of the sort of support that made any yoga class doable‚Äîeven for a (then) newbie like me.
Although the seriously durable classic Manduka PRO (6mm thick) is what many yoga teachers consider their go-to, I found the PROlite (4.7 mm thick) the perfect thickness and weight for toting to and from class. The PROlite stays in my trunk, where its always at the ready for a spontaneous drop-in, whereas my PRO lives in my living room. (The PRO is durable enough that is may outlive us all. But it‚Äôs also heavy.)
Manduka PROlite Yoga Mat for $81 ( $108 )
When you buy through our links, we may earn an affiliate commission. This supports our mission to get more people on their mats. Learn more .
The PROlite‚Äôs thinner build means less cushioning, which may be a deal-breaker for some, but certain fan-fave Manduka qualities, like the no-slip dot pattern on the bottom of the mat, remain. Expect a wrinkle-free, no-slide experience, no matter how quickly you transition between poses. Yoga Journal editors and friends have noted that all Manduka mats require a bit of time to break in but that the extra effort is well worth it. The PROlite also comes with Manduka‚Äôs lifetime guarantee.*
Playful colors like Passion Berry, Vulcan, Ray, Eden, and Galilee are included in the sale.
* Should your mat peel, flake, or fade, Manduka promises a replacement.

author: Vatican News
title: Empowering women religious as voices of change
text: By Sr. Roselyne Wambani Wafula, fsp "As Catholic sisters, we are called to serve those who are most vulnerable. The Hilton Foundation's support allows us to amplify our efforts and reach those who need it most. Our commitment to alleviating suffering and fostering positive change continues to inspire and empower millions around the globe,‚Äù Sister Jane explains. Sister Jane Wakahiu, a member of the Little Sisters of St. Francis and Associate Vice President for Programs at the Conrad N. Hilton Foundation, as well as Head of the Catholic Sister Initiative, brings a unique perspective to the world of philanthropy. Recently, Vatican News had the privilege of interviewing Sr. Jane about the important role the Hilton Foundation in empowering Catholic sisters around the globe. [ Audio Embed Listen to an excerpt from our interview with Sr Jane Wakahiu ] The power of communication "Why such a significant focus on Catholic sisters and communication?" the interviewer inquired. Sr. Jane's responds insightfully and thought-provokingly "Communication is central to everything we do. This is especially true for those who serve the Church." The Catholic Sisters Initiative recognizes this new reality. Silent forces for good, Catholic Sisters dedicate their lives to humanity. Yet, their voices are often lost. "Unlike even a decade ago," Sister Jane explains, "In today's world, communication is the cornerstone of effective ministry. It matters how we connect and share the message of faith," she said. The ability to share the message of hope, advocate for the marginalized, and connect with communities resides in clear and compelling communication. "Equipping our sisters with the skills to communicate effectively is no longer a luxury; it's a necessity. Catholic sisters are becoming powerful voices for social justice, education, and peacebuilding." Walking the talk What are the specific ways the Catholic Sisters Initiative empowers sisters in communication? "We offer a variety of programs," Sr. Jane elaborates. "These range from workshops on social media engagement to media training initiatives. We organize workshops and training in various communication fields, from social media and digital storytelling to media literacy and effective grant writing." "These skills empower sisters to share their stories, raise awareness about the needs of their communities, and ultimately, secure funding for their crucial work. We also facilitate opportunities for sisters to collaborate and learn from each other's experiences." Success stories The interview then shifted to the impact of the Catholic Sisters Initiative. Sr. Jane's face lit up with a smile knowing so many of us are beneficiaries of the Pentecost project and more. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve witnessed incredible changes," she said. "Sisters who once struggled to navigate the complexities of social media are now effectively utilizing it to connect with their communities and raise awareness about critical issues. Others have honed their communication skills and found powerful voices as advocates for the voiceless." Beyond numbers "While a decline in the number of sisters is a reality, we should not miss overlook the bigger picture.‚Äù she stated. "We must shift our focus to the vitality, quality and impact of those actively serving, celebrate their dedication, and empower them with the resources they need to continue their vital work. Their impact on the world is undeniable." Service with a difference Established in 1944 by the visionary hotelier Conrad Hilton, the foundation continues to serve those living in disadvantaged conditions. The foundation addresses issues such as homelessness, education, early childhood, migration, and global health. A ray of hope "There is so much good work being done," Sister Jane concludes. "The needs are great, and the opportunities for service are boundless. Let's focus on amplifying these stories, encouraging young women to consider a life of service, and supporting the sisters who are already changing the narrative, by ensuring that the legacy of alleviating suffering continues for generations to come."
